  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Zep Concentrated Calcium, Lime & Rust Stain Remover, 4 x 1 GAL bottles - 1 bottle had a loose cap and spilled approximately 75% of its contents, wetting and damaging outer packaging. There were inner slotted partitions or any other kind of inner packing. There were no other known packages damaged.

item.title: Report X-2024072052
item.description:
Report X-2024072052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AFTER FLIGHT ONE AIR PACKAGE REQUIRED PACKAGE REWRAP DUE TO THE BOX APPEARING WET. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS, WE DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX HAS AN ORANGE PERISHABLE STICKER AND A RED HANDLE WITH CARE, FRAGILE STICKER APPLIED.

item.title: Report X-2024071396
item.description:
Report X-2024071396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wisconsin Central Railroad Ltd.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 767744
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: X-2024071396-On June 27, 2024, at 1050 hrs., train X39691-26 was northbound on the Matteson subdivision near milepost 21.7 and derailed 25 railcars, Line 33-57. Line 51 / CGTX 64557 / Residue / Liquified Petroleum Gas / UN 1075. Class 2.1 was discovered with a side wall puncture resulting in the release of vapors. X-2024071397 On June 27, 2024, at 1050 hrs., X39691-26 was northbound on the Matteson subdivision near milepost 21.7 and derailed 25 railcars, Line 33-57. Line 50 PROX 35841 / Residue / Liquified Petroleum Gas / UN 1075. Class 2.1 sustained severe damage from an impact to the pressure housing. A leak was discovered from the pressure plate flange, five pressure plate stud bolts were tightened which secured the leak.

item.title: Report E-2024070512
item.description:
Report E-2024070512

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA notified ERTS of a cargo release of 1 cup of UN1263 "Spectrum Paint Admiral Pre Cat Lacquer" released from a 1-gallon metal pail. The release impacted the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they confirmed they felt comfortable that terminal personnel could clean the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged pail and impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024070571
item.description:
Report E-2024070571

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon (.5) of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture from a sharp object. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized the recovered material, PPE and the damaged drum in to one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FROZEN PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED SNUGGLEME RAW, PERISHABLE, FREEZE UPON ARRIVAL AND KEEP UPRIGHT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
